error.signature: service unable to place tasks: reason: no container instances available
error.regex: unable to place tasks.*no container instances

verdict.summary: ECS cannot schedule tasks because there are no EC2 instances with enough resources or the cluster has no instances.

dead_ends.why_fails: More tasks compete for the same insufficient resources

dead_ends.action: Terminating and relaunching the ECS service
dead_ends.why_fails: Service recreates but the capacity problem remains

workarounds.action: Scale up the Auto Scaling Group or add capacity providers
workarounds.how: Increase ASG desired count or use Fargate capacity provider

workarounds.action: Check task resource requirements (CPU/memory) vs instance capacity
workarounds.how: Task definitions may request more resources than instance types provide

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'service unable to place tasks' indicates ECS unable to place tasks on instances, while 'Task timed out after X.XX seconds (Lambda timeout)' indicates a network or operation timeout.
